ud7.7:1.3: “Judgment” (_saṅkhā_) refers to the way we “appraise” or “assess” ourselves, especially in relation to others (cf. [mn1:3.3](), [dn1:1.3.2]()). | “Proliferation” (_papañca_) is the compulsion of the mind to spread out in endless inner commentary that hides reality. | “Perceptions” refer to the underlying tendencies that cause us to interpret the present in terms of the past. See [mn18]() for a detailed explanation.
